comments:
Decsription:
   The joint dataset can not retrieve the data when one of datasets uses a remote xml file as the data source.

Steps to reproduce:
  1. download the attachmented design file
  2. preview the joint dataset in the window 'Edit dataset'. No data can be retrieved
  3. drag the joint dataset to the layout and preview, A record is retrieved.

Created an attachment (id=38664)
the design file
Since this bug is related with a bug with JDK, defer it.
PLease attach the stack trace and exception thrown by JDK.
This is common code path, we need to find a work around solution of the JDK bug.

The stack trace.

This usually happens when you are frequently reading a url.

Does joint data set always fail to get data from an URL or only fail some time like the test program?
Joint data set will occasionally throws exceptions, just as in test codes.

Please re-test this against a reliable remote URL (such as a URL on a local web server). This problem may very well have been caused by Eclipse.org not being reliable. This can be cancelled if the same error does not occur against a local web server URL.
I've re-tested the bug using local url but failed to reproduce it.It seems that the problem is caused by eclipse website as mentioned in Gary's comments. The bug is cancelled as appropriate.

traces.message: Unexpected end of file from server
